name: St. Regis, Monarch Beach

reviews.text: I have stayed at the St. Regis, Monarch Beach on an annual basis for the past few years. The rooms are beautiful and are very comfortable. Unfortunately, it seems if service has deteriorated a bit over the past few years. Service is certainly very good, it just lacks some of the polish that other hotels in this category offer. Additionally, the gym has limited hours (closes at 8p), which is a bit surprising for a resort of this caliber. Both the Michael Mina and the casual restaurant are very good.
reviews.title: Fine Hotel, But Not Fantastic

reviews.text: In the area, I would prefer to stay at the Ritz-Carlton or at the Montage.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, amazing grounds, decor, rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: one of the most beautiful hotels i have visited. the hotel is so well appointed and grand. you feel like you are in the middle of a tropical resort in some far away location. the rooms are so comfortable and beautifully appointed. my room faced the gardens and not the pools or beach but it was wonderful. the bar/restaurant was excellent for a late night snack. and glass of wine. i was there for work, but cannot wait to go back for a vacation when it is warmer. perfect for a romantic weekend.
reviews.title: Great Choice in Dana Point!

reviews.text: The St Regis was a great little getaway and has all of the luxury amenities you could want. They have an incredible spa with complimentary fitness classes, gorgeous grounds, excellent food (at Motif!!) and great service. It is truly all one can ask for. We were bummed that Stonehill Tavern was closed during our stay (Monday and Tuesday nights) but Motif had great food for breakfast/lunch. The rooms are clean and well appointed with everything you could need or ask for. I forgot my toothbrush and was going to call down to housekeeping to send one, and noticed they had them right there in the room already. We also left our cell phone charger at home and they had a ton to choose from to use that they lend out to guests.
reviews.title: LUXURY LUXURY LUXURY with a first-rate staff and wonderful array of amenities

reviews.text: The only complaint I have is that the hotel was not even close to fully booked and we had a complimentary upgrade at check in based on availability. This seemed hard to get and it didn't make sense to us why they wouldn't want to put us in a nicer room, given that it was part of our package and the rooms would go left vacant!
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.text: Just spent the long weekend down at st.regis. The last weekend wasn't so great but this trip was a delight - thank goodness. All in all the rooms and location was great as we had three all next to each with amazing views. Service was very good on this trip especially the spa and bech club.
reviews.title: Third time is a charm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resorts beach club is the best as its private, excellent restaurant and amazing ocean views. The Sunday brunch is one of the best in southern Cali. I was a little hesitant to go back but after some strong arming it proved to be great.
reviews.title: First Class all the way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is incredible and incredibly expensive.
reviews.title: Nice getaway

reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful, as is the landscaping and grounds. The pool is great with excellent service. There is a great shuttle that takes you back and forth to the beach which is also great with exceptional service.
reviews.title: Penny penching should not be a trait of 5 star hotels

reviews.text: The rooms are impeccable. Very large and very nice linens, huge bathroom, and great snacks.
reviews.title: Staff cannot make up for Rooms...

reviews.text: I was greatly looking forward to my stay at the St Regis Monarch Beach as a Starwood Preferred Guest Platinum member. I have seen some outstanding Starwood hotels with my 12 years as a Platinum member.The St Regis is supposed to be one of Starwoods top 5 star luxury brands.Having had the pleasure of staying at the St Regis in Houston last year with their outstanding service and fantastic beds I thought this too would be about as good as it gets. How wrong I was. My expectations run somewhat higher as a loyal Starwood program member and I realize that my published benefits wouldn’t apply to all guests regarding some of my concerns or expectations below
reviews.title: St Regis Monarch Beach a disappointment in almost every way

reviews.text: Upon Arrival
reviews.title: 5 star excellence with room for improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: • I drove up to the front of this multi million property at night in the pitch black.
reviews.title: Declining service

reviews.text: Imagine a luxury resort charging between 400 and 800 dollars a night for a guest room plus tax, parking and resort fees. Yet they cannot afford a light up sign directing incoming cars to the property where the check in and lobby are. It wasn’t a big deal however after a day of work and hours of car travel no one wants to go back and forth looking for the correct complex in the darkness of night where parking and check in take place
reviews.title: Beautiful Property, Inconsistent Service

reviews.text: • The front of the house was polished and professional reception was friendly and welcoming.The valet parking team were outstanding.Great first impressions
reviews.title: A relaxing resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been coming to this hotel for 3 years in a row now. From the moment you enter the St Regis Monarch Beach you know you are in one of the finest hotels in all of the US. The portico and the reception area are stunning examples of neoclassical architecure redone in a not-over-the-top manner. The staff are as friendly and well trained as any staff I have encountered in hotels around the world. Rooms seem to be cleaned by elves, as our room has always been straightened and cleaned nearly everytime we leave the room (even for 20 minutes) though I have never seen a maid... Rooms are stylish, comfortable and a little "jazzy" in their decor, often with fine (but distant) views of the ocean. However, this is probably the only hotel in the world were the term "pool view" is not a negative - the garden and pool area of this hotel is a landscaping masterpiece which just glows at night. Everything at this hotel is fanatastic - service, food, rooms, pool, ambiance. The down-side? The golf course (while very challenging and scenic) is typically not in very good shape.
reviews.title: A Jewel in Orange County

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice local getaway beautiful property. Nice loung bar with live band on weekends.
reviews.title: Great property

reviews.text: I just returned from this beautiful property and was won over by the magnificent entrance and welcome area. The front desk agent promptly greeted us and you could tell he was genuine in appreciation of our business. The bellman took us to our room, which was upgraded due to my platinum amex. The room was great and a fine balance between comfortable luxury and modern ammenities and style. The pools and property are fantastic. Dana Point is gorgeous.
reviews.title: Almost perfect, will return!

reviews.text: My reasons for not a perfect score: we requested an early check in on our reservation. I called two days before to see what they suggested, they said to call the day of and they could tell us. Called the day off and they said its a first come first serve basis and we had to be there in person. Just seemed inconsistent answers. The early check in was important to us as our time in the area was super short. They did however meet our request. Just wish I woulda been told the correct answer the first call. Next, the bellman took us to our room and couldn't get our keys to work. He used his master key to let us in and radiod the front desk, they allegedly activated the keys. After we got comfortable and set up in our room we went to go grab some breakfast. Went back to our room and our keys still didn't work. Our room was a ways away from the front desk and it was frustrating it wasn't fixed as stated already. Next the vallet service was hit and miss. The first time we needed our car we called and it was promptly ready, the next time we called it wasn't ready but it was parked closely up front so we walked to it but the keys weren't in it. Waited another ten min to get assistance from vallet to just get the keys. Finally at night we wanted room service. First call we were told they would call us back as the kitchen was busy. Fifteen minutes later we called back, was transfered, then hung up on. Third call we were again told within ten minutes we would get a call back. I just think there is a bit of confusion or chaos amoungst the staff.
reviews.title: Recent stay during conference

reviews.text: However, every employee we encountered was fantastic and helpful. Made us feel like the joint was our own. The fresh flowers everywhere is so nice. I will be back for sure.
reviews.title: Great Location & Service But Some Limitations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came the St. Regis for our honeymoon just a couple of weeks before the summer season got into full swing. It was the absolute perfect time to visit as the staff was ramped up for the rush, but the rush hadn't yet arrived. We found a huge staff available at any moment for anything from the pool, to the golf course, to the restaurants.
reviews.title: Lived up to its reputation in every way

reviews.text: The rooms are wonderfully comfortable with maid service in the morning/afternoon and then turn down service whenever you'd like. We had a courtyard view with a floor level patio. We ate breakfast out there every morning. The beds are heavenly. The bathrooms are luxurious. And then shined all my shoes for free!
reviews.title: An incredible haven of luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is minutes away. I recommend the tram, since when we walked it wasn't very well marked where pedestrians should go. There is a private beach club accessible to guests for food/drinks, and they will setup chairs and umbrellas for you on the sand.
reviews.title: Home Sweet Home

reviews.text: Spa Gaucin is beautiful. We didn't use any of the services (the prices were a bit out of our comfort zone), but we utilized the adult-only pool and spa. They also have daily group fit classes for free.
reviews.title: Nicest hotel I've ever stayed in

reviews.text: Every meals we had was great. We ate at the pool twice (highly recommend the Poke Salad), had coffee at Crust, and had our fancy dinner at Stonehill Tavern, which was amazing (we both had the tasting menu).
reviews.title: 1st option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your travel plans take you to Laguna Beach, the St. Regis Monarch Beach should be your choice. This is one of the most beautiful hotels you will ever see. The pool, garden areas
reviews.title: Look no further than the St. Regis, Monarch Beach

reviews.text: and walks down to the beach are amazing. The restaurants are all fabulous and the staff is more than just efficient. My husband and I have spent our anniversary at the St. Regis the past three years. I don't think we will change this in the future! Truly a wonderful full service hotel! Don't miss this gem!
reviews.title: Great hotel but the Ritz is better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel a dozen times over the last few years and it's a great hotel. The Sunday Brunch is the best in orange county PERIOD! I recently stayed at the Ritz and we enjoyed it better than this resort, the location is right
reviews.title: Great Improvement Over Last Visit, Up To 5 Star Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: on the beach for the same price. We were upgraded to a very nice suite but we
reviews.title: my favorite hotel

reviews.text: we were looking at a mountain. You can't go wrong with either hotel but if you're from out of town the view from the Ritz in my opinion is one of the best in california.
reviews.title: Lovely time

reviews.text: Great family vacation spot. Visiting LA and San Diego from the East Coast and this was a great stop in-between. Perfect grounds, nice balconies, great service at pool, valet, Beach Club, and housekeeping. Mid week stay late August was great- pool not crowded, no wait for ride to beach club, and valet had car waiting. California beach was covered in seaweed so not pristine but the surf valets set-up the chairs, towels and umbrellas which was great. Loved the fitness center. Clean, new, big and open. Lap pool was in a fantastic private courtyard.
reviews.title: Great property but don't expect a SPG Platinum U/G to a Suite

reviews.text: One disappointment is consistent with other SPG posters-is the desire by front desk staff to upsell to the $300.00 per night per room suite upgrade rather than accommodate the Platinum member. Trying to check in early, with connecting rooms and nothing available to upgrade to Executive suite but the St. Regis Suite is available, is available for early check in right now but it costs $300.00.
reviews.title: Hated It!

reviews.text: I guess I shouldn't expect the complementary suite upgrade (if the room is available) but I have grown accustomed to it as consistently the SPG brand earns exceptional loyalty at "W's" and Westin's worldwide by treating their Platinum members with "anything/anytime" attitude fighting for the business traveller's return business.
reviews.title: Not a friendly warm experience

reviews.text: Overall great hotel- standard rooms were spacious.
reviews.title: a true vacation

reviews.text: We stayed at this "fabulous" hotel but only to find out that the service sucks. The valet forgot our car! And the security guard (old, tall white security guard around 50s, with a superior attitude) chased us out of the hotel for taking pictures!!! Been around the world, never had this horrible experience before. He said that he'll charge us $1,500 if we want to take pictures. We would never recommend anyone to stay. No wonder this hotel is for sale again.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A friends decided Saturday morning to go away for the weekend and within an hour we had a great rate for the St Regis and a few hours later off to a weekend paradise.
reviews.title: Fantastic Weekend Resort just over an hour from LA!

reviews.text: The resort is amazing in that it transports you to another place so close to LA. The Service is top notch and we wanted for nothing - they knew our name at each dinner or spa reservation. Even opened the restaurant when late from the beach and they only had buffets for breakfast They really made an effort from valet to valet!
reviews.title: A completely forgettable experience

reviews.text: Even thou we all got garden rooms they were modern, comfortable, clean and luxury to its fullest. Room service was excellent. The Resort itself is so well designed and around the focus of the pool and fountain. It felt like I was back on the South of France looking over the property to the sea. The properties beach is a short tram ride through the golf course to an amazing private beach and club. The beach club is one of the best things here -cocktails at sunset and coffee after an early morning beach walk.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, snooty staffers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The REAL highlight is Michael Minas resturant - This was one of the best resturant experience and meal I have ever had in Southern Cal. The place is beautiful, meals and service mind blowing. Even thou its pricey none of us could quibble after the food was soooo amazing.
reviews.title: Lovely little getaway from LA

reviews.text: In short one of the best stay vacations for a while - way better that St.Barabara if your under 45!
reviews.title: Just what you hope for in a 5 star resort

reviews.text: We had a a really bad experience at this hotel. Reservation was booked five months in advance for our summer vacation. We have three kids under 10 and selection of hotel and room location is very important. When we arrived at 10 pm we were give rooms on the bottom floor at the very end of a long hallway. I requested new rooms right away, but was told hotel was fully booked for multiple weddings. I complained several times over the next two days and the hotel did nothing to fix the problem. Finally, we decided to check out after three nights and move to a real 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Not Impressed, Stay Elsewhere

reviews.text: My opinion is this hotel only caters to larger groups, weddings and corporate events. Vacation travels go somewhere else like the Ritz or Montage.
reviews.title: Almost don't want to say how fabulous it is and keep it for myself!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will be back St. Regis! What a lovely property! The rooms are gorgeous and spacious. The bathrooms are huge and the bathtubs are roomie! The little carts down to the beach are adorable. The private beach is SUBLIME! We had a private surf lesson for my daughter's birthday and she LOVED it! The food was wonderful. It's close to adorable Laguna (which we are dying to get back to soon so we can shop more!) The spa was SO lovely and all the staff was exceptional. Every detail was attended to! The sweet man who was entertaining at the piano even allowed my daughter (who is an accomplished singer and piano player) perform an Adele song one evening for all the guests!!! So memorable and exciting for her!
reviews.title: Truly amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cannot wait to go back!
reviews.title: 4 p.m. check in policy and property thoughts compared to the Ritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked using starwood points. From the minute we got there till the min we left we felt like we were in paradise! Staff A+++ Rooms A+++
reviews.title: Days of Delight in Dana

reviews.text: We have traveled many times to this hotel as a couple and with our children and have loved it every time. This trip was with children and another friend who came with her children. We requested connecting rooms and we very glad the hotel could accommodate this request. It really made the trip fun for the kids. The adult pool is separate from the kids pool which is great as there was no problem with worrying about the kids making too much noise. The service around the pool was quick and the staff was attentive. We ordered room service several times and everything was delicious. A wonderful top notch resort. Recommended for couples as well as families. There is shuttle service to the beach but it was a little chilly so we just stayed at the pool. It's a large resort so a drawback is long hallways to the rooms.
reviews.title: beautiful resort

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are comfortable. But for the money paid for the rooms, The Four Seasons or The Ritz has much better service. Upon arrival, I was surprised by the amount of dogs on the property. It must be a California thing. Our room was lovely, until we stepped in a huge wet spot on the carpeting, and the smell of vinegar in our room. Our guess was that a dog had an accident and it was tried to be cleaned by the guest before us. Unless you were barefoot, you would not know the spot was there. We notified the front desk, and were told there were no other rooms available. They sent someone from housekeeping and comped us the parking fee and resort fee for our entire stay. That was kind, but still there was dog pee in our room.
reviews.title: For the money, average service

reviews.text: The resort was just nothing special, except the fitness center. It was very nice. I don't know how to explain it. I just know at The Four Seasons, I felt like a god, because of the service. At the St. Regis, I felt like just another guest.
reviews.title: Pristine Southern California Hotel Destination

reviews.text: The St. Regis Monarch Beach Beach is a gorgeous property with impeccable service and amazing rooms. I was surprised at the extra attention they paid to our children. Few hotels can compete with the overall package of the St. Regis.
reviews.title: Service?

reviews.text: Attended a wedding. Facilities are gorgeous, but the dinner was so disappointing. It felt as if the hotel threw 30 waiters into the room and said "serve these people." The service was horrible!!!
reviews.title: Front desk need help

reviews.text: Little sad to write this short review but we love the St. Regis Monarch Beach and things have slipped in places that are just not right. This is our second long weekend down from Hollywood and the first one was fantastic. We looked forward to relaxation, beach, service and luxury with our large family group (8). It was all very mixed and now unsure if its worth the considerable expense – it is very expensive but in the past worth it.
reviews.title: Diversity does spend a lot of money but not at the St.Regis anymore!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service has Slipped – Check in is now more McDonald’s drive thru, Valet is timeless as in 45 min to retrieve a car, billing was a mess and still not resolved. The biggest down fall was how the St.Regis handled other obnoxious guests – we had two occurrences when guests made it very uncomfortable for our culturally and ethnically diverse group. The second occurrence at the Stone Hill Tavern was horrific – 8 of us were celebrating and spending a lot of money on a dinner which turned horrifically sour when the table next us “Asked us to move”, glared at us, spoke to us like servants. Their table was in a thoroughfare (like ours) so we had to walk past them to the bathroom or patio. We let it slide but when the St.Regis Staff asked us not to walk past the table (impossible) and make allowances. I voiced our concern and nothing was done – Oh the St.Regis doesn’t care either!
reviews.title: Par Excellence

reviews.text: That was the end of “I love the St.Regis”. Diversity does spend a lot of money but not at the St.Regis anymore!
reviews.title: Almost Perfect

reviews.text: The staff and service at the St. Regis, Monarch Beach was exceptional. The "Stonehill Tavern" restaurant is certainly a great experience. The Fitness center is top notch with many amenities. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and meticulously maintained. The staff is warm,, approachable and courteous. The grounds are manicured a treat to walk. The golf course is challenging (unfortunately I played during fairway aeration) and the greens ran true. The three holes that run along the Pacific are beautiful, to say the least. All in all a wonderful experience and we will be back.
reviews.title: Serenity Now

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The St. Regis at Monarch Beach is beautiful property. As noted by the amount of weddings they can cram into one Saturday. This does lead to a crowded feeling, but I was here for a conference as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful property, easy access to beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a second visit to the St. Regis. It is very well run, beautifully appointed in a stunning location. It is expensive .... luckily we used some Starwood points to reduce the cost but be prepared for pricey food, even at the little coffee cafe. The food is delicious and it is a great place.
reviews.title: A Very Special Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live less than 2 hours away so it is an easy getaway --- but I am sure this property would appeal to travelers from everywhere. It is well located to many interesting places and very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Good resort with great spa experience

reviews.text: St. Regis has its private Monarch Beach access. We liked the beach but was less impressed with the windy and more wet beach than the one of Laguna and Long Beach, also Newport. The highlight is that the resort has a world class golf course, a restaurant with private beach access (where you can see the sunset), two bars on the deck viewing the golf green and the beach.
reviews.title: What is not to love??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our highlight was really the spa experience of the Wellness Package: this turned into a good massage for two, lemon bubble bath completed with chardonnay by a fireplace in teh same room we received the massage. The staff was less friendly but the ambience is terrific.
reviews.title: Great resort in a beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yoga was part of the package, and the instructor was very flexible with our levels and location preference - we requested to do it outside in the courtyard on the lawn (the beach was too cold and windy that particular day).
reviews.title: Will try it again in the off-season

reviews.text: It wasn't perfect, but the location was great and the rooms were huge. Its a nice stay for a family except that you have to walk far to almost everything. We don't mind walking, so that wasn't a huge problem for us. They just do some funny, unnecessary things though. Such as a butler service where a guy comes and gives you a bunch of brochures for activities you never asked about. I expect that in foreign places needing tourism, but not so much at the St. Regis in So Cal...Also, the general manager was there greeting people in the lobby which was a friendly touch, but then it took almost 30 minutes to get an ice tea by the pool...
reviews.title: Expectations met

reviews.text: I really like the beach area they have and its perfect for kids. They set up everything you need right there and the service was super sweet, eager-to-help teenagers (or college kids) who were probably doing this as their summer job. I liked that is wasn't pretentious or trying-too-hard employees. The real unfortunate part was the food at the beach grill outside. It was quite bad and super expensive, plus the menu only had a few items. If you are at the beach with kids, this is really your only option for a quick meal unless you want to go to the restaurant on the beach (forget the name).
reviews.title: 4th of July 2013 Ruined!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would go back, I just know now what to avoid.
reviews.title: great place to escape east coast in the summer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh- the Michael Mina restaurant Stone Tavern was really good for dinner! That definitely did not disappoint.
reviews.title: Beautiful getaway!

reviews.text: This hotel could not have failed any further. From check-in to filthy room to terrible food and awful service. Truly a bad mark for St. Regis. Using other St. Regis hotels as a benchmarks - this is not only fair but sad. Horrid waste of money!!!
reviews.title: Everything you would expect.

reviews.text: The hotel is a beautiful facility with stunning views over the pool and garden towards the ocean. The room I had was well appointed and comfortable. A colleague of mine got an upgrade and had complimentary butler service (pressed shirts, French press coffee). The restaurant (Motif) provided fine meals, and the breakfast buffet was excellent. My main criticism of the hotel is that I couldn't get good Verizon service (not the hotel's fault) or use the hotel's wifi service that was included with my mandatory $25 per day resort fee. My Apple devices and the various hotel wifi zones (one for the lobby, another for the patio, another for my room) just never really got in synch. if this hadn't been a business trip, perhaps I wouldn't have minded this spotty connection so much and instead focused on the beautiful weather and scenery.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with spotty wifi service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a weekend at the St Regis Monarch Beach at the last minute to get in a few days of golf prior to a business meeting in LA. We booked the Unlimited Golf package and although the neighbouring golf course was certainly not our favourite that we have played, our experience at the hotel was outstanding.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on reviews, I was concerned about the level of service, but our experience with the staff was exceptional across the board - the valets, shuttle drivers, front desk staff & management were all excellent.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, shame about the service

reviews.text: We booked a signature guest room, but were upgraded upon check in to an executive suite (we are active SPG members) in the north tower that overlooked the golf course. The room was spacious and stunning. We much preferred the golf course view to that of the pool since our patio was far more private. I would not suggest paying a premium for an ocean view as the hotel sits on the other side of the PCH and the ocean view is distant and indirect.
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.text: Our butler service was excellent - helping with everything from booking tee times to extremely prompt coffee delivery to timely wake up calls.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary! It was a wonderful hotel and we enjoyed it! The beach area was beautiful as well and everyone we encountered was very friendly and accomodating. We were upgraded to a suite which was amazing! They also surprised us with a fruit tray and wine because of our anniversary. It was a great stay and it is definitely a place I would love to go back to again!
reviews.title: Very Nice Anniversary Stay!

reviews.text: I attended a business conference at the St. Regis and was impressed with the hotel, grounds and golf course. The hotel is beautiful and upon arrival, I found a short wait (3 people checking in) and the concierge was right that apologizing for the delay. The wait was less than 2 minutes, but it was nice to have the attention.
reviews.title: Great 3 day business trip...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in was a breeze and since this was my first visit, the young lady at the check in desk walked me to the elevators to ensure I found them okay.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Uber expensive and odd beach setup

reviews.text: The room was spacious, bed comfortable and the balcony with two chairs was a nice change from normal hotels. Too bad I hit Dana Point during a winter storm, but I enjoyed leaving the door open to get fresh air into the room. On down side to the room was it did not have a coffee pot. I am up early and had to go downstair to a small cafe to get coffee. Other than that, the room had everything.
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend at the St. Regis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Conference facilities were great and the staff was attentive, polite and seemed to do anything needed to make you feel comfortable.
reviews.title: we ran out of superlatives!...

reviews.text: Lovely property with wonderfully fresh, clean rooms and marvelous bathrooms. The Staff was extraordinary. The Beach Club is a must for dinner under a perfect sunset. I am a very picky frequent traveller (read - pain in my husband's neck) yet I have no issues with this beautiful hotel. I will say that it is NOT right on the beach. It overlooks a golf course, road, then the beach. You take a jitney down to the Beach Club and great beach. If you want to be right right on the Beach, stay at the Ritz, 5 minutes down the road and equally as terrific. My husband won't believe I wrote this.
reviews.title: Top Notch St. Regis

reviews.text: St. Regis has their own ideas about room upgrades, and they aren't consistent with SPG. I am a platinum member with starwood and therefore am entitled to upgrades when available. This property has TWICE held me up for $250 per night fees in order to get the upgrades I am supposed to get free. This seems to be their policy; ignore SPG elites and do whatever they want.
reviews.title: Total Shakedown

reviews.text: Also, sink was dirty in my room and minibar was empty. Waited 30 minutes for tram down to the beach each way, they claimed it would never be more than 15 min. Just really disappointed. And to complete it....they charge for the high speed Internet starwood elites are supposed to get free.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel with good business facilities

reviews.text: I stayed here for a work conference and had a great time. The room was very spacious and comfortable. The conference and after hour events were well organized and creative (e.g. game night, international night with cocktails and appetizers from around the world). The pool was gorgeous, but the service at the bar was slow. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would recommend the hotel for both personal and business trips.
reviews.title: Great hotel and Brilliant Staff

reviews.text: We had a terrific stay at the St Regis Dana Point on our recent trip from Scotland with our family. Jared and his front desk staff did a tremendous job and Biswas, the F+B Director really went the extra mile to look after us. Breakfast is spectacular and I am glad that we were able to extend our stay for the Friday night story and s'mores tradition.
reviews.title: Not up to St Regis standards

aka: St. Regis, Monarch Beach Hotel Dana Point
description: Overlooking the Pacific Ocean stands The St. Regis Monarch Beach. Crowned with the Forbes Five-Star, AAA Five-Diamond Award, the resort delivers an experience beyond expectation.
